newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana gets dedicated Internet earth station.
newsitem.headline: Ghana gets dedicated Internet earth station.

text.p: A company describing itself as Ghana's main Internet provider has installed an Intelsat Satellite earth station to serve as a gateway to the World Wide Web in the West African country.
Network Computer Systems Ltd (NCS), a Ghanaian company which has 500 subscribers, installed the earth station on Wednesday to boost access to the Web, engineering manager Mike Baidoo told Reuters.
"With the new earth station we can connect up to 10,000 subscribers," he said, adding that retrieval time was much quicker.
Previously, NCS connected subscribers to the Internet via the Ghana Telecom Earthstation in Nkutunse, near Accra.
Apart from NCS, there is one other provider of Internet, Electromod, which has about 100 subscribers. Three other internet service providers have been authorized to commence business in Ghana.
